data.title: ExOp chooses Next Level DSL to provide video, voice, and data services
data.meta_description: Competitive local exchange carrier (CLEC) ExOp of Missouri Inc. has signed a two year agreement worth some $50 million dollar for digital subscriber...
data.text:
Competitive local exchange carrier (CLEC) ExOp of Missouri Inc. has signed a two year agreement worth some $50 million dollar for digital subscriber line (DSL) equipment from Next Level Communications Inc. (Rohnert Park, CA). A developer of asynchronous transfer mode (ATM)/Internet protocol interactive DSL broadband systems, Next Level will provide its NLevel3 Unified Access Platform to ExOp. The CLEC currently offers video and data services in cities and towns in Kansas City, MI, and surrounding communities.

Under the agreement, Next Level will supply ExOp with the access equipment necessary to provide video and high-speed data over copper twisted pair to residences and businesses. Next Level will also provide N3 Residential Gateways (set-top boxes) for video, data, and very-high bandwidth DSL (VDSL) ETHERsets. ExOp will be offering its service package to approximately 170,000 customers in the initial rollout. Future plans included expansion to other markets locally as well as other states.

In addition to bundled telephony, video, and data services, ExOp offers a service package to its subscribers that includes an option to lease a large screen TV. "ExOp wants our customers to enjoy the full benefit of digital technology," said Tom White, president of ExOp. "Offering our customers state-of-the art equipment from Next Level and high-quality TV options allows them to get the most from their entertainment experience."

ExOp's service offering includes 80 channels of broadcast video, with another 20 channels of pay-per-view (PPV) programming. Customers also have a selection of high-speed dynamic selectable data services from 64 Kbps to 2 Mbps. Future plans include enhancements such as interactive TV and video-on-demand (VOD), which will be supported by the N3 Residential Gateway.

ExOp of Missouri Inc. is a competitive local exchange carrier founded in 1996 and is an affiliate of Utilicorp Communication Services, a wholly owned subsidiary of UtiliCorp United based in Kansas City, MI. ExOp is community infrastructure overbuilder that provides video and high-speed data and telephony services to the rural areas of Missouri and other communities served by Utilicorp United.
